label: assump-assumption-regularity-summary
title: Summary of Regularity Assumptions
nl_summary: Summarizes the key regularity assumptions (H1-H5) ensuring well-posedness of the coupled mean-field system, which hold for the Canonical Euclidean Gas model.

bullet_items.name: (H1)
bullet_items.text: The domains $X_{\text{valid}}$ and $V_{\text{alg}}$ are bounded and have smooth ($C^2$) boundaries.
bullet_items.latex: The domains $X_{\text{valid}}$ and $V_{\text{alg}}$ are bounded and have smooth ($C^2$) boundaries.

bullet_items.name: (H2)
bullet_items.text: The reward potential $R_{\text{pos}}$ is $C^2$, making the force field $F$ globally Lipschitz.
bullet_items.latex: The reward potential $R_{\text{pos}}$ is $C^2$, making the force field $F$ globally Lipschitz.

bullet_items.name: (H3)
bullet_items.text: The flow field $u$ is $C^1$, and all physical parameters ($m, \gamma_{\text{fric}}, \Theta, \sigma_x$) are finite and positive.
bullet_items.latex: The flow field $u$ is $C^1$, and all physical parameters ($m, \gamma_{\text{fric}}, \Theta, \sigma_x$) are finite and positive.

bullet_items.name: (H4)
bullet_items.text: All algorithmic functions (e.g., the rescale function, companion selection) are measurable and satisfy the continuity properties established in the abstract framework.
bullet_items.latex: All algorithmic functions (e.g., the rescale function, companion selection) are measurable and satisfy the continuity properties established in the abstract framework.

bullet_items.name: (H5)
bullet_items.text: The killing rate function $c(z)$ is smooth ($C^\infty$), non-negative, and has compact support in a neighborhood of $\partial X_{\text{valid}}$.
bullet_items.latex: The killing rate function $c(z)$ is smooth ($C^\infty$), non-negative, and has compact support in a neighborhood of $\partial X_{\text{valid}}$.

label: assump-assumption-domain-regularity
title: Regularity of the Valid Domain
nl_summary: The valid position domain X_valid in R^d is open and bounded with a C^3 boundary; its signed distance function d(x) is C^2 in a tubular neighborhood T_delta of width delta > 0, and the unit inward normal n_x(x) = -∇d(x) is defined there.

bullet_items.name: Smoothness
bullet_items.text: X_valid is an open, bounded domain with C^3 boundary ∂X_valid.
bullet_items.latex: $X_{\text{valid}}$ is an open, bounded domain with $C^3$ boundary $\partial X_{\text{valid}}$.

bullet_items.name: Distance Function
bullet_items.text: The signed distance function d(x) := dist(x, ∂X_valid) is C^2 in a tubular neighborhood T_δ := {x ∈ X_valid : d(x) < δ} for some δ > 0.
bullet_items.latex: The signed distance function $d(x) := \text{dist}(x, \partial X_{\text{valid}})$ is $C^2$ in a tubular neighborhood $\mathcal{T}_\delta := \{x \in X_{\text{valid}} : d(x) < \delta\}$ for some $\delta > 0$.

bullet_items.name: Unit Inward Normal
bullet_items.text: For each x ∈ T_δ, let n_x(x) = -∇d(x) denote the unit inward normal vector (pointing into X_valid).
bullet_items.latex: For each $x \in \mathcal{T}_\delta$, let $n_x(x) = -\nabla d(x)$ denote the unit inward normal vector (pointing into $X_{\text{valid}}$).

conditions.text: X_valid is an open, bounded domain with C^3 boundary ∂X_valid.
conditions.latex: $X_{\text{valid}}$ is an open, bounded domain with $C^3$ boundary $\partial X_{\text{valid}}$.

conditions.text: Signed distance function d(x) is C^2 in tubular neighborhood T_δ for δ > 0.
Unit inward normal n_x(x) = -∇d(x) defined for x in T_δ.

parameters.name: valid position domain
parameters.description: Open, bounded subset of R^d with C^3 boundary

parameters.name: tubular neighborhood width
parameters.description: Positive radius for the tubular neighborhood

parameters.name: signed distance function
parameters.description: Distance to the boundary partial X_valid

parameters.name: unit inward normal
parameters.description: Unit normal vector pointing into X_valid

label: assump-assumption-integrator-regularity
title: Regularity of the Discrete Integrator
nl_summary: Assumes the BAOAB discrete kinetic integrator updates positions via a deterministic form with velocity, force, and a bounded remainder term, ensuring regularity.

bullet_items.text: The discrete kinetic integrator (BAOAB) produces position updates of the form
bullet_items.latex: x^+(\tau; x,v) = x + v\tau + \frac{\tau^2}{2m}F(x) + R_{\text{pos}}(\tau; x,v)

conditions.text: The position update follows the specified form with remainder term R_pos.
conditions.latex: x^+(\tau; x,v) = x + v\tau + \frac{\tau^2}{2m}F(x) + R_{\text{pos}}(\tau; x,v)

parameters.name: force function
parameters.description: Force derived from potential at position x.

parameters.name: position remainder
parameters.description: Remainder term in the position update.

label: assump-assumption-density-regularity-killing
title: Density Regularity
nl_summary: The phase-space density f^τ at the start of each discrete timestep is bounded in L^∞(Ω) by M_f and is spatially C^1-regular with its gradient bounded in L^∞ by M_{∇f}.

parameters.name: Boundedness constant
parameters.description: Upper bound for the L^∞ norm of f^τ.

parameters.name: Gradient boundedness constant
parameters.description: Upper bound for the L^∞ norm of the spatial gradient of f^τ.
